headline.main: Important Arrest by the Detective Police.; HEAVY EMBEZZLEMENT BY A CONFIDENTIAL CLERK, AND RECOVERY OF $50,000 OF THE STOLEN FUNDS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Detectives Elder and McCord yesterday morning secured the arrest of a Prussian, known as J.F. de l' Are, alias Newman or Nieman, but whose real name is Ludovic Joachim Julius Tode, on a charge of being a fugitive from St. Petersburg, Russia, where he is alleged to have embezzled, in the month of August, 1859, the sum of $55,000 from an English firm, by whom he was employed as confidential clerk.

docs.snippet: The Board held their first regular meeting yesterday, after the recess, and were honored by the attendance of a large and evidently interested lobby.

headline.main: BOARD OF COUNCILMEN.; BOARD OF COUNCILMEN. PRESENTATION OF A STAND OF COLORS TO THE SEVENTH REGIMENT MORE HOSPITALITIES OF THE CITY TO BE EXTENDED TO DISTINGUISHED VISITORS, AND $1,600 ASKED FOR TO ENTERTAIN THEM.

docs.snippet: By the steamship City of Manchester, which was intercepted by the news yacht of the Associated Press off Cape Race yesterday, we received European advices one day later.

headline.main: BOARD OF HEALTH.; A DUMPING-GROUND REINSTATED IN FAVOR.

docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen, after a brief vacation, met again at 5 P.M. yesterday. All the members and many spectators were present. Little of interest was transacted.

docs.snippet: A summary of the political advices by the Fulton, whose arrival off Cape Race was announced in Saturday morning's TIMES, has reached us. Large bodies of revolutionists had landed in Cala  bria, where they had been joined by insurgents to the number...
docs.lead_paragraph: A summary of the political advices by the Fulton, whose arrival off Cape Race was announced in Saturday morning's TIMES, has reached us. Large bodies of revolutionists had landed in Cala bria, where they had been joined by insurgents to the number of two thousand, with whom they had retired temporarily to the mountains.

headline.main: GENERAL TELEGRAPHIC NEWS; ADDITIONAL FROM EUROPE. The Invasion of the Neapolitan Coast Desertions to the Garibaldian Army Increase of the Austrian Marine Budget.LATEST EUROPEAN MARKETS. Speech of Hon. A.H. Stephens of Georgia. Movements of Senator Douglas. Acquittal of Joseph Oliver. Annual Statement of Movements of Cotton at New-Orleans. Death of Mrs. Gen. Garland. The Baltimore City Park. Sailing of the Powhatan for Vers Cruz. Movements of Mr. Seward.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the Fulton off Cape Race, with European advices to the 22d ult., was announced in Saturday morning's TIMES. Owing to an interruption in the telegraph wires, the whole of the Fulton's news was not telegraphed. The balance has now been received and is as follows:

docs.snippet: The steamship Cahawba, J.W. SMITH, Commander, from New Orleans and Havana, arrived here yesterday at one o'clock P.M., four days from Havana. The Cahawba left New Orleans at 8 o'clock A.M. on the 25th ult., reaching Havana on the 27th, at 2 P.M.,...

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Cahawba A Slave-Steamer Captured The Bark Wildfire Stolen and Recaptured, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Cahawba, J.W. SMITH, Commander, from New Orleans and Havana, arrived here yesterday at one o'clock P.M., four days from Havana. The Cahawba left New Orleans at 8 o'clock A.M. on the 25th ult., reaching Havana on the 27th, at 2 P.M., from whence she took her departure for this port at 1 P.M. on the 28th.
